subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Text entry tool for junior on windows
msgSnippet: This is extremely interesting. I await the Mac version. By the way, the fonts in readme.doc are not displaying properly for me (using Word 2004 for Mac, on
messageBody:
This is extremely interesting. I await the Mac version.

By the way, the fonts in 'readme.doc' are not displaying properly for
me (using Word 2004 for Mac, on OS X 10.4.11). I do have ThothUni
installed.

Ted


On Nov 28, 2007 6:30 AM, Anthony Grahn <othermale@...> wrote:
>
>
>
>
>
>
> I'm guilty of making statements about comparative ease of typing
> without providing the means to demonstrate or disprove my claims.
> To alleviate this, I have created and uploaded a tool for typing QS
> Unicode characters (junior) using more or less normal TO letters and
> digraphs: No shift keys or unusual keyboard letters for QS letters.
> You do not have to install the program in any special way, nor do you
> need to install any additional software like keyman.
>
>
> http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Read_Alphabet/files/Text%20Entry/quickscript_junior_keyboard_windows.zip
>
> The instructions for using the tool are in the Read Me (in particular
> which key(s) to press for which QS letter). The most important
> instruction is this: control-space toggles back to normal Latin
> typing, control-space again to type in QS. You can quit the tool by
> right clicking its icon in the system tray and selecting 'exit'.
>
> As an aside, if one can get a ThothUni font tag (or the like) in a
> post to the group, one could include Latin and QS letters easily.
>
> I'll upload a Mac version shortly.
>
>
